1st conjugation infinitive, to change it to the present tense remove <b>-ть</b> and replace with: (читать)	я - <strong>ю</strong><br>ты - <strong>ешь</strong><br>он, она, оно - <strong>ет<br></strong>мы - <strong>ем</strong><br>вы - <strong>ете<br></strong>они -&nbsp;<strong>ют</strong><br>	
2nd conjugation infinitive, to change it to the present tense remove <b>-ить</b> or <b>-еть</b> and replace with: (говорить)	я - <strong>ю</strong><br>ты - <strong>ишь</strong><br>он она оно - <strong>ит</strong><br>мы - <strong>им</strong><br>вы - <strong>ите</strong><br>они - <strong>ят</strong>	
все	everyone	
Consonants at the end of words д is pronounced like?	т	
Consonants at the end of words г is pronounced like?	к	
Consonants at the end of words в is pronounced like?	ф	
Consonants at the end of words з is pronounced like?	с	
Consonants at the end of words ж is pronounced like?	ш	
Consonants at the end of words б is pronounced like?	п	
люб<b>и</b>мый	favorite	
масло	oil	
м<b>а</b>ленький	small	
н<b>о</b>вый	new	
крас<b>и</b>вый	beautiful	
Adjective ending with masculine noun	ый<br>ий (in case of spelling rule)<br>ой (if the ending is stressed)	
Adjective ending with feminine noun	ая	
Adjective ending with neutor noun	"ое<br>ее (because of spelling rule ж ш ч щ ) cannot use ""o"" only ""е"""	
In Russian, in the nominative case, you make a plurals by using the letters (include letters for all genders)	"""и"", ""ы"", ""я"" or ""а"""	
In Russian, in the nominative case, you make a masculine noun plural by	"If the word ends in a consonant, add “ы”. (<strong>unless previous consonant is Г, К, Х, Ж, Ч, Ш, Щ then replace with ""и"" as per the spelling rules.</strong>)<br>    Replace endings of “й” with “и”<br>    Replace endings of “ь” with “и”"	
In Russian, in the nominative case, you make a femanin noun plural by	"Replacing endings of “я” with “и”<br>    Replacing endings of&nbsp;&nbsp;“ь” with “и”<br>    Replacing endings of&nbsp;&nbsp;“а” with “ы” (<strong>unless previous consonant is Г, К, Х, Ж, Ч, Ш, Щ then replace with ""и"" as per the spelling rules.</strong>)"	
In Russian, in the nominative case, you make a neuter noun plural by	Replacing “о” with “а”<br>    Replacing “е” with “я”	
"To change infinitive ending in -ть to present tense accompanied by ""я"" replace -ть with"	ю	
"To change infinitive ending in -ть to present tense accompanied by ""ты"" replace -ть with"	ешь	
"To change infinitive ending in -ть to present tense accompanied by ""он/она/оно"" replace -ть with"	ет	
"To change infinitive ending in -ть to present tense accompanied by ""мы"" replace -ть with"	ем	
"To change infinitive ending in -ть to present tense accompanied by ""вы"" replace -ть with"	ете	
"To change infinitive ending in -ть to present tense accompanied by ""они"" replace -ть with"	ют	
"To change infinitive ending in -ить or -еть to present tense accompanied by ""я"" replace -ить/-еть with"	ю	
"To change infinitive ending in -ить or -еть to present tense accompanied by ""ты"" replace -ить/-еть with"	ишь	
"To change infinitive ending in -ить or -еть to present tense accompanied by ""он/она/оно"" replace -ить/-еть with"	ит	
"To change infinitive ending in -ить or -еть to present tense accompanied by ""мы"" replace -ить/-еть with"	им	
"To change infinitive ending in -ить or -еть to present tense accompanied by ""вы"" replace -ить/-еть with"	ите	
"To change infinitive ending in -ить or -еть to present tense accompanied by ""они"" replace -ить/-еть with"	ят	
What consonants can&nbsp;ы NOT follow?	"Г, К, Х, Ж, Ч, Ш, Щ and so it must be replaced with ""и"""	
Adjective ending with plural nouns	ые<br>ие (if spelling rule used)	
Masculine Nouns in Prepositional Case	1. Add : “е”. <br>2: Some nouns (mostly single syllable) take “у” (but not after preposition “о”)	
Feminine Nouns in Prepositional Case	"1. Replace “а” with “е”. <br>2. Replace “я” with “е”. <br>3. Replace “ь” with “и”.<br>4. Replace ""ия"" with ""ии"""	
Neuter Nouns in Prepositional Case	1. Replace “о” with “е” <br>2. “е” remains unchanged.	
Plurals Nouns in Prepositional Case	"Look at the last letter nominative singular form (dictionary form) and... <br>1. Replace ""а"", ""о"" or a consonant with ""ах"". <br>2. Replace the last letter with ""ях"""	
Pronouns in Prepositional Case	Мне - Me <br>Тебе - You <br>Нём - Him <br>Ней - Her <br>Нём - It <br>Нас - Us <br>Вас - You (Plural) <br>Них - Them	
"""о"" rule"	"An unstressed ""о"" is reduced to either a weak ""а"" sound if the ""о"" is at the beginning of the word or in the syllable immediately before the stress"	
Masculine Ending in Nomnative Case	Consonant<br>-й<br>-ь	
Femanin Ending in Nomnative Case	-а<br>-я	
Neuter Ending in Nomnative Case	-о<br>-е	
его	"""его"" anywhere in the word are pronounced as ""иво"""	
зд<strong>а</strong>ние	building	
магаз<strong>и</strong>ны	the shops	
ст<strong>а</strong>рый	old	
плащ	cloak	
ш<strong>а</strong>пка	hat	
пальт<strong>о</strong>	coat	
в<strong>е</strong>щи	things	
б<strong>е</strong>лый	white	
кост<strong>ю</strong>м	costume	
сумка	bag	
пл<strong>а</strong>тье	dress	
бр<strong>ю</strong>ки	pants	
чёрный	the black	
каранд<strong>а</strong>ш	pencil	
р<strong>у</strong>чка	pen	
кр<strong>е</strong>сло	armchair	
портф<strong>е</strong>ли	portfolios	
воспроизвод<b>и</b>тся	Playing? (from tabs in browser)	
од<b>и</b>н	one	
два	two	
три	three	
чет<b>ы</b>ре	four	
пять	five	
шесть	six	
семь	seven	
в<b>о</b>семь	eight	
д<b>е</b>вять	nine	
д<b>е</b>сять	ten
